III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide of the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth sexually penetrated Youth A due to a lack of supervision.
Investigation Complainant
I called Complainant on 08/28/2023 and left a message.
Complainant texted me back on 08/28/2023 and asked who I was.
I texted back the information and did not receive a return call or
text.
Youth A
Youth A was at Wolverine Center from 03/23/2023 to 06/08/2023.
I interviewed Youth A on 08/25/2023 at his current placement,
Optimist House. Youth A stated when he was at Wolverine Center
a youth forced him to touch his penis and masturbate him in
06/2023. Youth A stated it happened somewhere on the second
floor and it was either around breakfast or dinner time. Youth A
stated there was no youth witnesses and staff did not witness the
incident because the staff person was in the hallway. Youth A
stated the staff person wrote a report and gave it to Chief
administrator and nothing happened. Youth A stated he did not
know the name of the youth perpetrator or the staff person in the
hallway. Youth A could not explain how he knew a report was
written. Youth A did not have further details for this investigation.
Youth A’s foster care worker was contacted on 09/15/2023.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker. Youth
B was selected for an interview because Youth A and Youth B
were at Wolverine Center during the same time. Youth B stated he
did not recall Youth A. Youth B stated he is unaware of a sexual
incident occurring at Wolverine Center.
Chief administrator
I interviewed the Chief administrator on 08/28/2023 by phone.
Chief administrator stated there are no incident reports about
2

Youth A involved in a sexual incident or boundary incident with
another youth at Wolverine Center. Chief administrator stated
sexual allegations are report to the youth’s therapist, worker and
reported to central intake.
Therapist
I interviewed Therapist on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Therapist stated he met with Youth A once a week when Youth A
was at Wolverine Center and Youth A never mentioned a
boundary incident or sexual incident.
Supervisor
I interviewed Supervisor on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Supervisor stated Youth A never reported a sexual incident.
Supervisor stated any sexual incident would be reported to
appropriate parties because she is a mandated reporter.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center
with another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Staff person 1 stated Youth A never reported a sexual incident,
but recalled Youth A acted strange by refusing to play basketball
prior to leaving Wolverine Center.
Health coordinator
I interviewed Health coordinator on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine
Center with another Department of Health and Human Service
worker. Health coordinator stated she never saw Youth A for
anything related to a sexual incident.
Video
Video footage is not available for 06/2023.
Toured
Toured the first and second-floor of Wolverine Center.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency
attended Youth A’s Kids Talk on 09/21/2023. Youth A did not
disclose any sexual incident occurring at Wolverine Center.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency stated
law enforcement completed their investigation without finding.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency
completed an investigation without finding.
3

Analysis It is not found based on the interviews and lack of documentation
that a sexual incident occurred between Youth A and another
youth sometime in 06/2023 at Wolverine Center. This investigation
will be reopened if further information becomes available.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
